wms_article.title: SeAH Group develops Korea’s first ultra-high-temperature alloy

wms_article_body.body: South Korea’s SeAH Group said on Sunday it has developed the country’s first ultra-high-temperature alloy, a technology available only in a handful of advanced economies such as the United States and Japan. SeAHCSS Corp., a subsidiary of the group, plans to deliver prototype materials for turbine engine retainers to Hanwha Aerospace Co. by the end of August. “We have already completed production of the prototype and are in discussions with Hanwha Aerospace on official supply,” a SeAH Group representative said. The alloy, made mainly from nickel and cobalt, can withstand temperatures of more than 900 degrees Celsius compared with around 700 degrees Celsius for conventional grades. The company said the development marks Korea’s first successful commercialization of the advanced material.
